<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Sure, an iPad is cool, but you know what your cousins really want for the holidays? The gift of <em>knowledge</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Free newsletter subscriptions have been deemed the “hottest present of 2021” by 4 out of 4 Morning Brew writers, so if you want to keep up with the trends, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/refer-a-friend?access_token={{profile.vars.access_token}}&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">share the Brew far and wide</a> this holiday season. When you do, you’ll earn free swag from us, including stickers, a sleek notebook, and even the iconic Brewneck.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/fda-approves-first-covid-pill-to-be-taken-at-home?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Unleash the Covid Pills
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/fda-approves-first-covid-pill-to-be-taken-at-home?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Two pills being handed out as seen in 'The Matrix'" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/b6a44ddccc2d2e32d6f358bf9353cfbbb5ed6833-1200x800.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>The Matrix</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s probably not a coincidence that on the same day the new <em>Matrix </em>is released we get great news about pills.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the FDA <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-science-business-health-medication-f5f65e7e61d6aa9c7dfa193053e8878a?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">authorized</a> the use of Pfizer’s antiviral pill for people infected with Covid. The pill is the first Covid treatment made available outside of the hospital, and, because of the convenience factor and low cost, experts say it’ll be a game-changer for limiting the number of Covid deaths.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How does it work? </strong>People ages 12 and up deemed most at risk of hospitalization can take the drug orally at home within five days of developing Covid symptoms. If they do, a visit to the ER will likely be unnecessary: A key study showed that the pill, called Paxlovid, reduced the risk of hospitalization or death by 88% in vulnerable, unvaccinated patients.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Even better, Paxlovid has also been shown to be highly effective against Omicron.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Covid pills like Paxlovid (and another from Merck, which is also due for FDA clearance) aren’t considered replacements for vaccines. And early supplies of Paxlovid will be limited until Pfizer can accelerate production. Still, one of the best Christmas presents we could’ve hoped for is a drug that protects the most vulnerable people from the worst effects of Covid.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Here’s what else is happening in the world of Omicron</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Is Omicron less severe? </strong>Could be. People infected with Omicron in South Africa are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-22/omicron-has-80-lower-risk-of-hospitalization-new-study-shows?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">80% less likely</a> to be hospitalized than those infected with other Covid strains, a new study found yesterday. Other data from Scotland showed that the risk of hospitalization from Omicron was <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/covid-19-booster-offers-substantial-protection-against-symptomatic-infection-with-omicron-study-finds-11640191103?mod=hp_lead_pos1" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two-thirds lower</a> than from Delta. Researchers cautioned that Omicron could still lead to overwhelmed hospitals just by the sheer number of people it infects.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shorter isolation time in the UK: </strong>People who test positive for Covid in the UK could <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/22/uk-shortens-covid-19-isolation-period-to-7-days-in-england.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">leave quarantine</a> in seven days as opposed to the previously required 10, the British health minister said yesterday. But to get out of isolation in the shorter timeframe, you need to pop negative lateral flow tests (aka rapid tests) on two consecutive days. Btw, the US is also considering <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-21/biden-team-weighing-shorter-covid-isolation-for-vaccinated?utm_source=google&utm_medium=bd&cmpId=google" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reducing quarantine times</a> for people with breakthrough cases.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Israel <3 its boosters: </strong>The country plans to offer a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israel-offer-fourth-dose-covid-19-vaccine-people-over-60-2021-12-21/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>fourth</em> Covid vaccine dose</a> to immunocompromised people, everyone over 60, and health care workers in order to blunt the effects of Omicron.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Test hoarders, beware: </strong>Walgreens, CVS, Amazon, and Walmart are all <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/12/21/business/cvs-walgreens-covid-test-limit/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">limiting</a> the number of at-home Covid tests you can buy in response to high demand.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/biden-extends-student-loan-freeze-as-omicron-surges?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Three Months Is Plenty of Time to Find $30k
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After months of menacing “Don’t forget to set up autopay” emails from your loan provider, you can tell them to lose your address for the next 90 days. Yesterday, President Biden <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/12/22/1066879033/biden-federal-student-loan-payment-freeze-extension-borrowers?utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=twitter" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">extended</a> the freeze on student loan payments and interest accrual to May 1.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A moratorium on student loan payments has been in place since March 2020, but after receiving a number of extensions, it was set to expire on Jan. 31. Less than two weeks ago, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki told reporters that there wouldn’t be any more extensions—but Biden said the not-so-over pandemic changed those plans.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>According to a survey by progressive think tank Data for Progress, 49% of roughly 500 student loan borrowers felt “not at all confident” they’d be able to make payments that started on Feb. 1.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Before he was elected, Biden said he supported canceling $10,000 in student loans per borrower. He’s facing growing pressure from students and progressive politicians to make good on that campaign pledge, but some, like New York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, have urged him to cancel student debt altogether.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/retailers-and-delivery-companies-thwart-the-supply-chain-s-attempt-to-ruin-christmas?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Supply Chains Are the Grinch Who Didn't Steal Christmas
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/retailers-and-delivery-companies-thwart-the-supply-chain-s-attempt-to-ruin-christmas?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A truck unloading a container" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=490 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-12-22/image-c13a75dba071aefff017bd037c05dd701d544dbb-460x336-gif/giphy(4).gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A truck unloading a container" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-12-22/image-c13a75dba071aefff017bd037c05dd701d544dbb-460x336-gif/giphy(4).gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Giphy</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you dropped the ball on your sister’s gift this holiday season, you’re going to have to find an excuse other than “supply chains.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Despite ominous warnings of barren shelves and in-demand electronics stranded on cargo ships, most people haven’t had any issue with getting their gifts delivered in time for Christmas, the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/22/business/christmas-gifts-delivery-supply-chain.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT reports</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>UPS and the postal service delivered about 99% of their packages on time or with minimal delays, according to ShipMatrix.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FedEx wasn’t far behind, at 97%.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, by one measure, UPS, FedEx, and the postal service are delivering packages faster now than in the post-Thanksgiving period in 2019.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened? </strong>As the legendary basketball coach John Wooden once said, “When you fail to prepare, you’re preparing to fail.” And prepare retailers did—by beefing up fulfillment staff, sending in orders ahead of time, and encouraging shoppers to buy gifts much earlier to ease the crunch. 26 of UPS’s 30 largest retail customers offered substantial deals before Black Friday, a company exec told the NYT.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Tokyo is facing a <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/1783b893-431a-4054-b677-f7667563aae2?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$12.7 billion bill</a> for hosting the Olympics this summer, nearly twice as much as originally planned. But going over budget is common for Olympic host cities, and Japan’s miscalculation was actually far less egregious than most—the average cost overrun for cities hosting the Olympics since 1960 is 172%, according to Oxford researchers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Very disappointed in this product. No scent.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Angry Yankee Candle customers are increasingly <a href="https://twitter.com/drewtoothpaste/status/1473360059908374539?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">leaving 1-star reviews</a> on Amazon, and it could possibly be a result of the latest Omicron wave. Very crude research has shown that “no smell” complaints for Yankee Candles has correlated with spikes in case numbers over the last two years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>This scientist created a rapid test just weeks into the pandemic. Here’s why you still can’t get it. (<a href="https://www.propublica.org/article/this-scientist-created-a-rapid-test-just-weeks-into-the-pandemic-heres-why-you-still-cant-get-it?s=09" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ProPublica</a>)</p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/regulators-probe-tesla-over-in-vehicle-video-games?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Regulators Throw Red Shells at Tesla
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/regulators-probe-tesla-over-in-vehicle-video-games?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="The media center of a Tesla playing a game" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/55faf0e18c76b54542791d123ef3f4711433c73b-1700x956.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SkeFAiRxtM8">YouTube</a></em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla is under fire for allowing drivers to ditch the steering wheel for the joystick. Yesterday, federal auto regulators at the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-opens-investigation-into-580000-tesla-vehicles-over-game-feature-2021-12-22/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revealed</a> they’re investigating the automaker over a new feature that lets you game and drive at the same time.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>An update sent to Tesla vehicles this summer enabled “Passenger Play”—which allows solitaire, a jet fighter video game, or a strategy game to run on the car’s main console screen while someone’s driving. It went <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/07/business/tesla-video-game-driving.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largely unnoticed</a> until a NYT report put it on the hot seat earlier this month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NHTSA argues Passenger Play is dangerous not only because the driver can simply click the “I am a passenger” button and play, but also because a passenger playing on Tesla’s diner menu-sized screens can be distracting.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The agency is already investigating Tesla vehicles for its Autopilot software, which steers, slows, and speeds up cars on its own. Autopilot has been reportedly connected to 11 crashes of stationary first-responder vehicles and has faced criticism for allowing drivers to take their hands off the wheel and eyes off the road.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>if the NHTSA finds fault in its preliminary investigation, it could upgrade its probe to what’s called an “engineering analysis,” the final phase before issuing a recall.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

The Puzzle Section

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>We’re going hard with the Christmas-themed puzzles, and no Scrooge can tell us to do otherwise. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/brew-mini-yule?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play today’s Mini here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than your mom’s 100-calorie Oreo packs. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>An extinct millipede the length of a car once </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/12/20/1065759563/extinct-millipede-car-northern-england-arthropleura?utm_source=npr_newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=20211221&utm_term=6122605&utm_campaign=news&utm_id=46082882&orgid=305&utm_att1=" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">roamed</a></span><span> northern England</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Cortana would be </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/12/20/22846906/steve-ballmer-cortana-windows-phone-assistant-name-bingo-alyx-microsoft?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">named</a></span><span> Bingo if Steve Ballmer had his way</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Japanese officials </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-22/japanese-officials-beg-public-to-drink-more-milk-as-glut-worsens?sref=fjrBr5qu" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beg</a></span><span> public to drink more milk as glut worsens</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>One of the </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/VbhLF9VRbTHZLgwgz2/giphy.gif?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most popular</a></span><span> gifts this year is exclusive TikTok sounds</span>
</li>
</ol>
</div>

class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Two pills being handed out as seen in 'The Matrix'\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/b6a44ddccc2d2e32d6f358bf9353cfbbb5ed6833-1200x800.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s probably not a coincidence that on the same day the new \u003cem\u003eMatrix \u003c/em\u003eis released we get great news about pills.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the FDA \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-science-business-health-medication-f5f65e7e61d6aa9c7dfa193053e8878a?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eauthorized\u003c/a\u003e the use of Pfizer’s antiviral pill for people infected with Covid. The pill is the first Covid treatment made available outside of the hospital, and, because of the convenience factor and low cost, experts say it’ll be a game-changer for limiting the number of Covid deaths.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow does it work? \u003c/strong\u003ePeople ages 12 and up deemed most at risk of hospitalization can take the drug orally at home within five days of developing Covid symptoms. If they do, a visit to the ER will likely be unnecessary: A key study showed that the pill, called Paxlovid, reduced the risk of hospitalization or death by 88% in vulnerable, unvaccinated patients.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEven better, Paxlovid has also been shown to be highly effective against Omicron.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Covid pills like Paxlovid (and another from Merck, which is also due for FDA clearance) aren’t considered replacements for vaccines. And early supplies of Paxlovid will be limited until Pfizer can accelerate production. Still, one of the best Christmas presents we could’ve hoped for is a drug that protects the most vulnerable people from the worst effects of Covid.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHere’s what else is happening in the world of Omicron\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIs Omicron less severe? \u003c/strong\u003eCould be. People infected with Omicron in South Africa are \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-22/omicron-has-80-lower-risk-of-hospitalization-new-study-shows?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e80% less likely\u003c/a\u003e to be hospitalized than those infected with other Covid strains, a new study found yesterday. Other data from Scotland showed that the risk of hospitalization from Omicron was \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/covid-19-booster-offers-substantial-protection-against-symptomatic-infection-with-omicron-study-finds-11640191103?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etwo-thirds lower\u003c/a\u003e than from Delta. Researchers cautioned that Omicron could still lead to overwhelmed hospitals just by the sheer number of people it infects.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShorter isolation time in the UK: \u003c/strong\u003ePeople who test positive for Covid in the UK could \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/22/uk-shortens-covid-19-isolation-period-to-7-days-in-england.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleave quarantine\u003c/a\u003e in seven days as opposed to the previously required 10, the British health minister said yesterday. But to get out of isolation in the shorter timeframe, you need to pop negative lateral flow tests (aka rapid tests) on two consecutive days. Btw, the US is also considering \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-21/biden-team-weighing-shorter-covid-isolation-for-vaccinated?utm_source=google\u0026utm_medium=bd\u0026cmpId=google\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereducing quarantine times\u003c/a\u003e for people with breakthrough cases.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIsrael \u003c3 its boosters: \u003c/strong\u003eThe country plans to offer a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israel-offer-fourth-dose-covid-19-vaccine-people-over-60-2021-12-21/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efourth\u003c/em\u003e Covid vaccine dose\u003c/a\u003e to immunocompromised people, everyone over 60, and health care workers in order to blunt the effects of Omicron.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTest hoarders, beware: \u003c/strong\u003eWalgreens, CVS, Amazon, and Walmart are all \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/12/21/business/cvs-walgreens-covid-test-limit/index.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elimiting\u003c/a\u003e the number of at-home Covid tests you can buy in response to high menacing “Don’t forget to set up autopay” emails from your loan provider, you can tell them to lose your address for the next 90 days. Yesterday, President Biden \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/12/22/1066879033/biden-federal-student-loan-payment-freeze-extension-borrowers?utm_source=dlvr.it\u0026utm_medium=twitter\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eextended\u003c/a\u003e the freeze on student loan payments and interest accrual to May 1.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA moratorium on student loan payments has been in place since March 2020, but after receiving a number of extensions, it was set to expire on Jan. 31. Less than two weeks ago, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki told reporters that there wouldn’t be any more extensions—but Biden said the not-so-over pandemic changed those plans.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAccording to a survey by progressive think tank Data for Progress, 49% of roughly 500 student loan borrowers felt “not at all confident” they’d be able to make payments that started on Feb. 1.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Before he was elected, Biden said he supported canceling $10,000 in student loans per borrower. He’s facing growing pressure from students and progressive politicians to make good on that campaign pledge, but some, like New York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, have urged him to cancel student debt altogether.—\u003cem\u003eMM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you dropped the ball on your sister’s gift this holiday season, you’re going to have to find an excuse other than “supply chains.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDespite ominous warnings of barren shelves and in-demand electronics stranded on cargo ships, most people haven’t had any issue with getting their gifts delivered in time for Christmas, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/22/business/christmas-gifts-delivery-supply-chain.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT reports\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUPS and the postal service delivered about 99% of their packages on time or with minimal delays, according to ShipMatrix.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFedEx wasn’t far behind, at 97%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn fact, by one measure, UPS, FedEx, and the postal service are delivering packages faster now than in the post-Thanksgiving period in 2019.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened? \u003c/strong\u003eAs the legendary basketball coach John Wooden once said, “When you fail to prepare, you’re preparing to fail.” And prepare retailers did—by beefing up fulfillment staff, sending in orders ahead of time, and encouraging shoppers to buy gifts much earlier to ease the crunch. 26 of UPS’s 30 largest retail customers offered substantial deals before Black Friday, a company exec told the NYT.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SkeFAiRxtM8\"\u003eYouTube\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTesla is under fire for allowing drivers to ditch the steering wheel for the joystick. Yesterday, federal auto regulators at the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-opens-investigation-into-580000-tesla-vehicles-over-game-feature-2021-12-22/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erevealed\u003c/a\u003e they’re investigating the automaker over a new feature that lets you game and drive at the same time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAn update sent to Tesla vehicles this summer enabled “Passenger Play”—which allows solitaire, a jet fighter video game, or a strategy game to run on the car’s main console screen while someone’s driving. It went \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/07/business/tesla-video-game-driving.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elargely unnoticed\u003c/a\u003e until a NYT report put it on the hot seat earlier this month.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe NHTSA argues Passenger Play is dangerous not only because the driver can simply click the “I am a passenger” button and play, but also because a passenger playing on Tesla’s diner menu-sized screens can be distracting.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe agency is already investigating Tesla vehicles for its Autopilot software, which steers, slows, and speeds up cars on its own. Autopilot has been reportedly connected to 11 crashes of stationary first-responder vehicles and has faced criticism for allowing drivers to take their hands off the wheel and eyes off the road.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eif the NHTSA finds fault in its preliminary investigation, it could upgrade its probe to what’s called an “engineering analysis,” the final phase before issuing a recall.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
